SENT.plain: Recurrence of the Takotsubo syndrome is possible, and in the majority of cases it occurs within 4 years
The present report is focused on a case of the Takotsubo syndrome recurrence after 10 years

The patient had been admitted for the first time in 1999 with a diagnosis of "non-q wave acute anterolateral myocardial infarction." Ten years later, she was readmitted for suspected acute myocardial infarction; coronary arteries, however, were normal, and the left ventricular angiogram demonstrated apical ballooning typical for the Takotsubo syndrome
It is worth noting that the clinical presentation and the ECG were the same on both occasions; in addition, both events were triggered by an emotional stress
